intro: Allophylus decaryi, commonly known as the African holly, is a small evergreen shrub native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its dense, leathery leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces orange-red berries that are an important food source for various birds and mammals. Allophylus decaryi typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories. Its ornamental value has led to its cultivation in some regions for landscaping purposes.
